subject: Data
title: Real-Time Bidding: The Auction for Your Eyeballs
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Real-Time Bidding: The Auction for Your Eyeballs.

hook.text: Every time a webpage loads, an auction happens in 100 milliseconds. Advertisers bid for the right to show you an ad.

buildup.text: Real-time bidding (RTB) is the automated auction system behind most online display advertising.

discovery.text: Your data profile is broadcast to dozens of advertisers simultaneously. The highest bidder's ad appears.

twist.text: Over 500 billion RTB auctions happen daily. Your data is shared with thousands of companies per page load.

climax.text: Privacy advocates call RTB the largest data breach in history â€” it's just legal and continuous.

punchline.text: Every page load is an auction â€” and you're the item.

quiz.question: How fast does a real-time bidding auction typically occur?
